metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7813 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Inside the JavaScript parser, a cast of an integer to a narrower type canresult in data read from outside the buffer being parsed. This usuallyresults in a non-exploitable crash, but can leak a limited amount ofinformation from memory if it matches JavaScript identifier syntax. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 56.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0+build6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
